stories.headline: BREAKING: Wolverines penalty!
stories.bodyText:
The NCAA tacked on a third suspension game for Moore — forcing Michigan to navigate a critical September stretch without its head coach.

Michigan opens with New Mexico before a marquee Sept. 9 matchup at Oklahoma — a Big Ten vs. SEC clash that now looms even larger without Moore on the sideline.

stories.headline: Oh, it's you AGAIN!
stories.bodyText:
Anthony Davis, now with the Mavericks, will play his first game back in LA on Nov. 28

The Davis-Dončić swap happened mere hours after the Lakers played at Madison Square Garden last season, adding a layer of “only in the NBA” chaos to the saga.

stories.headline: Dodgers descent
stories.bodyText:
After being swept by the Angels, the Dodgers fell out of first for the first time since April 27, now chasing a surging Padres team.

The Padres haven’t held sole possession of first this late in the season since September 25, 2010.

stories.headline: Manning Money
stories.bodyText:
Wait to see draft order and team situations before deciding

NFL scouts expect the Mannings to weigh which team holds the No. 1 pick, who the coach is, and overall fit — and with NIL money, there’s no rush to enter the league.

stories.headline: Caitlin's fever
stories.bodyText:
Clark has been sidelined for 19 of the Fever’s 32 games, including her latest stretch out with a groin injury suffered on July 15.

Despite missing Clark, the Fever are 10-9 without her and 6-2 over their last eight games.

stories.headline: Was it worth it?
stories.bodyText:
Nine out of 10 former players — even many who said football wrecked their bodies and minds — said they’d do it all over again because the game gave them money, fame, and life-defining moments.

One player said he’d play again despite an early Alzheimer’s diagnosis, because the competition and camaraderie were worth it.
